title: Percentage Discount Calculator
description: Calculate the final price after a percentage discount.

faqs.question: Does it support decimals?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can use decimal prices and percentage values.

title: Simple Interest Calculator
description: Compute simple interest based on principal, rate and time.

faqs.question: Is compounding included?
faqs.answer: No. Use a compound interest calculator for compounding.

title: BMI Calculator
description: Estimate Body Mass Index from weight (kg) and height (cm).

faqs.question: What is BMI?
faqs.answer: A simple index of weight-for-height commonly used to classify underweight, overweight and obesity.

title: Daily Calorie Burn (Rough)
description: Rough estimate of daily calories burned from steps and exercise minutes.

faqs.question: Is this accurate?
faqs.answer: It is a rough estimate; for precision use a medical-grade calculator.

faqs.question: Does it support negatives?
faqs.answer: Yes, negative temperatures are supported.

faqs.question: Is the factor exact?
faqs.answer: We use the standard 1 km = 0.621371 miles.

faqs.question: How precise is this conversion?
faqs.answer: It uses the exact factor of 3.28084 feet per meter.

title: Percentage Increase
description: Get the percentage increase from an old value to a new value.

faqs.question: What if old value is 0?
faqs.answer: Percentage change is undefined when the old value is 0.

title: Circle Area
description: Compute area of a circle from its radius.

faqs.question: Units?
faqs.answer: Area units are squared units of the input (e.g., cm²).

title: Download Time
description: Estimate seconds to download a file by size and speed.

faqs.question: Overheads considered?
faqs.answer: No, this is the ideal time without protocol overheads.

title: Storage Redundancy Overhead
description: Compute overhead percentage when storing data with redundancy.

faqs.question: What if data is 0?
faqs.answer: Overhead is undefined when data is 0.

title: Duration to Seconds
description: Convert hours, minutes, and seconds into total seconds.

faqs.question: Supports decimals?
faqs.answer: Use whole numbers for simplicity in this tool.

faqs.question: Leap days?
faqs.answer: This is a simple conversion (24h per day).

title: Paint Coverage
description: Estimate litres of paint needed given area and coverage.

faqs.question: Number of coats?
faqs.answer: Multiply result by the number of coats you plan to apply.

title: Garden Soil Volume
description: Compute soil volume for a rectangular bed (m³).

faqs.question: Irregular shapes?
faqs.answer: Approximate by splitting into rectangles and summing volumes.

title: Tip Calculator
description: Calculate total bill including tip percentage.

faqs.question: Split bills?
faqs.answer: Divide the result by the number of people to split the bill.

title: Grade Average
description: Compute the average from three test scores.

faqs.question: Weighted average?
faqs.answer: This tool uses a simple mean (unweighted).

title: Calories Burned (MET) Calculator
intro: Estimate calories burned using MET, weight, and duration. Enter the values and press Calculate.

examples.description: Jogging at MET 7, 70 kg, 30 minutes → about 257 kcal

faqs.question: What is a MET?
faqs.answer: A MET is a unit that estimates energy cost of physical activities.

title: Daily Water Intake Calculator
intro: Rough estimate of daily water intake from body weight. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Daily Water Intake Calculator do?
faqs.answer: Rough estimate of daily water intake from body weight. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Waist-to-Height Ratio Calculator
intro: Compute waist-to-height ratio (WHtR). Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Waist-to-Height Ratio Calculator do?
faqs.answer: Compute waist-to-height ratio (WHtR). Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Data Transfer Time Calculator
intro: Estimate time to transfer data over a connection speed. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Data Transfer Time Calculator do?
faqs.answer: Estimate time to transfer data over a connection speed. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: KB to MB Converter
intro: Convert kilobytes to megabytes. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the KB to MB Converter do?
faqs.answer: Convert kilobytes to megabytes. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Download Cost Calculator
intro: Estimate download cost from data size and price per GB. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Download Cost Calculator do?
faqs.answer: Estimate download cost from data size and price per GB. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: DPI Calculator
intro: Dots per inch from pixels and inches. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the DPI Calculator do?
faqs.answer: Dots per inch from pixels and inches. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Minutes to Seconds Calculator
intro: Convert minutes to seconds. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Minutes to Seconds Calculator do?
faqs.answer: Convert minutes to seconds. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Weeks to Days Calculator
intro: Convert weeks to days. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Weeks to Days Calculator do?
faqs.answer: Convert weeks to days. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Years to Days Calculator
intro: Approximate years to days (365). Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Years to Days Calculator do?
faqs.answer: Approximate years to days (365). Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Paint Needed Calculator
intro: Estimate liters of paint required. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Paint Needed Calculator do?
faqs.answer: Estimate liters of paint required. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Flooring Cost Calculator
intro: Estimate total floor cost. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Flooring Cost Calculator do?
faqs.answer: Estimate total floor cost. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Concrete Slab Volume
intro: Volume for a slab in cubic meters. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Concrete Slab Volume do?
faqs.answer: Volume for a slab in cubic meters. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Wallpaper Roll Coverage
intro: Number of rolls needed. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Wallpaper Roll Coverage do?
faqs.answer: Number of rolls needed. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Fuel Trip Cost
intro: Estimate fuel trip cost. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Fuel Trip Cost do?
faqs.answer: Estimate fuel trip cost. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Division Calculator
description: Performs division in the Home & DIY category.

faqs.question: What does this calculator do?
faqs.answer: It performs basic division operations.

title: Pythagorean Theorem Calculator
intro: Calculate the hypotenuse of a right triangle. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Pythagorean Theorem Calculator do?
faqs.answer: Calculate the hypotenuse of a right triangle. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Discount Calculator
intro: Determine final price after a percentage discount. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Discount Calculator do?
faqs.answer: Determine final price after a percentage discount. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Discount Calculator
intro: Determine final price after a percentage discount. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Discount Calculator do?
faqs.answer: Determine final price after a percentage discount. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Tip Calculator
intro: Calculate the tip amount from bill and percentage. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What does the Tip Calculator do?
faqs.answer: Calculate the tip amount from bill and percentage. Enter the values and press Calculate.

title: Smoots to Meters
intro: Convert smoots into meters.

faqs.question: What is a smoot?
faqs.answer: A smoot is a playful unit of length equal to 1.7018 meters.

title: Hogsheads to Liters
intro: Convert hogsheads into liters.

faqs.question: Where is the hogshead used?
faqs.answer: The hogshead is an old imperial unit for liquid volume.

title: Furlongs per Fortnight to Meters per Second
intro: Turn whimsical speed units into meters per second.

faqs.question: Is this a real unit?
faqs.answer: Yes, but it's mostly used for geeky humor.

title: Mars Sol to Earth Days
intro: Convert Martian sols into Earth days.

faqs.question: What is a sol?
faqs.answer: A sol is a Martian day lasting about 24 hours 39 minutes.

title: Microfortnight to Seconds
intro: Convert microfortnights into seconds.

faqs.question: Why microfortnights?
faqs.answer: They are a humorous unit equal to 1.2096 seconds.

title: Pomodoro Session Duration
intro: Estimate total time for a Pomodoro session set.

faqs.question: Why subtract one break?
faqs.answer: The final session usually has no break afterward.

title: Crypto Mining Breakeven Time
intro: Estimate days to recoup mining hardware cost.

faqs.question: Does this include electricity?
faqs.answer: Include electricity in daily profit for accuracy.

title: Freelancer Hourly Rate
intro: Find required hourly rate from income goals.

faqs.question: Why billable hours?
faqs.answer: Non‑billable time isn't paid, so exclude it to price correctly.

title: Subscription Lifetime Value
intro: Compute lifetime value of a subscription.

faqs.question: Does this include churn?
faqs.answer: Use average retention to account for churn.

title: Sleep Debt Weekly
intro: Estimate weekly sleep debt from average nightly rest.

faqs.question: What if result is negative?
faqs.answer: Negative means you exceed the 8‑hour recommendation.

title: Sugar Cube Equivalent
intro: Convert grams of sugar into sugar cube equivalents.

faqs.question: How much is one sugar cube?
faqs.answer: About 4 grams of sugar per cube.

title: Caffeine Half-Life
intro: Estimate remaining caffeine over time.

faqs.question: What half-life is assumed?
faqs.answer: This uses an average half-life of 5 hours.

title: Rainwater Harvest Volume
intro: Estimate rainwater collection volume.

faqs.question: Why divide by 1000?
faqs.answer: To convert liters to cubic meters.

title: Garden Soil Weight
intro: Calculate soil weight for a garden bed.

faqs.question: Why approximate density?
faqs.answer: Different soils vary; 1200 kg/m³ is a common average.

title: Brick Count Estimator
intro: Estimate number of bricks for a wall.

faqs.question: Does this include mortar gaps?
faqs.answer: No, add extra bricks for mortar and waste.

title: Geometric Series Sum
intro: Sum of the first n terms of a geometric series.

faqs.question: What if r=1?
faqs.answer: The sum is simply first term times n.

title: Circle Circumference from Area
intro: Derive circumference when only area is known.

faqs.question: Why such a long number?
faqs.answer: It's a high-precision value of π.

title: Triangle Inradius
intro: Compute radius of the inscribed circle of a triangle.

faqs.question: What is inradius?
faqs.answer: It's the radius of the circle tangent to all sides of the triangle.

title: Battery Life Estimator
intro: Approximate device runtime from battery specs.

faqs.question: Is this precise?
faqs.answer: Actual battery life varies with conditions.

title: CPU Power to Current
intro: Convert CPU power draw to current at given voltage.

faqs.question: What is TDP?
faqs.answer: Thermal design power, a CPU's typical power draw.

title: Bandwidth Delay Product
intro: Estimate in-flight data on a network link.

faqs.question: Why divide by 8?
faqs.answer: To convert bits to bytes.

title: Coffee to Water Ratio
intro: Calculate water needed for a coffee brew ratio.

faqs.question: Is ratio coffee:water?
faqs.answer: Yes, multiply coffee grams by ratio for water grams.

title: Reading Time Estimator
intro: Estimate reading time from word count.

faqs.question: Typical speed?
faqs.answer: Around 200 words per minute for non‑technical texts.

title: Travel Budget per Day
intro: Spread a trip budget over travel days.

faqs.question: Include travel days?
faqs.answer: Yes, count every day of the trip.

title: Emergency Fund Duration
intro: Estimate how many months your savings can cover expenses.

faqs.question: Does it include income?
faqs.answer: No, it only divides savings by monthly expenses.

title: FIRE Number Calculator
intro: Compute target savings for financial independence using annual expenses and withdrawal rate.

faqs.question: What is FIRE?
faqs.answer: FIRE stands for Financial Independence, Retire Early.

title: Loss Recovery Percentage
intro: Find the gain needed to recover from a portfolio drop.

faqs.question: Why is the required gain higher?
faqs.answer: Because gains and losses are based on different starting amounts.

title: Protein Calorie Percentage
intro: Percentage of calories coming from protein.

faqs.question: Why multiply by 4?
faqs.answer: Each gram of protein has roughly 4 calories.

title: BMI Prime Calculator
intro: BMI normalized to the upper healthy limit of 25.

faqs.question: What does BMI Prime indicate?
faqs.answer: Values above 1.0 are considered overweight.

title: Heart Rate Reserve Percentage
intro: Current training intensity as a percentage of heart rate reserve.

faqs.question: What zones use this value?
faqs.answer: It's used in the Karvonen method to set training zones.

title: Banana Equivalent Dose Converter
intro: Convert radiation dose into banana equivalents.

faqs.question: How much radiation is one banana?
faqs.answer: About 0.1 µSv per banana.

title: Beard-second to Meters
intro: Translate beard-seconds into meters.

faqs.question: What is a beard-second?
faqs.answer: It's the length of a beard's growth in one second, about 5 nanometers.

title: Sheppey to Meters
intro: Convert sheppeys into meters.

faqs.question: What's a sheppey?
faqs.answer: A whimsical unit equal to about 1.4 km—the distance at which sheep remain picturesque.

title: Triangle Area (Heron's Formula)
intro: Area of a triangle from three sides using Heron's formula.

faqs.question: When is Heron's formula useful?
faqs.answer: When you know all sides but not the height.

title: 2D Point Distance Calculator
intro: Distance between two points in a plane.

faqs.question: What distance formula is used?
faqs.answer: The standard Euclidean distance.

title: Polygon Diagonals Calculator
intro: Number of diagonals in an n‑sided polygon.

faqs.question: Does it work for triangles?
faqs.answer: Yes, but a triangle has 0 diagonals.

title: Ping Distance Estimator
intro: Approximate signal distance from round-trip ping time.

faqs.question: Why divide by two?
faqs.answer: Ping measures round-trip time, so distance is half.

title: Screen PPI Calculator
intro: Pixels per inch from resolution and diagonal size.

faqs.question: What does PPI mean?
faqs.answer: Pixels per inch indicates display sharpness.

title: SSD Lifespan in Years
intro: Estimate years until rated endurance is reached.

faqs.question: What is TBW?
faqs.answer: Terabytes written—an endurance rating for SSDs.

title: Earth Years to Mars Years
intro: Convert Earth years into Martian years.

faqs.question: How long is a Mars year?
faqs.answer: About 1.8808 Earth years.

title: Jiffies to Seconds
intro: Convert jiffies (1/60 sec) into seconds.

faqs.question: What is a jiffy?
faqs.answer: In electronics, it's the period of one 60 Hz cycle (~0.0167 s).

title: Sidereal Day to Hours
intro: Convert sidereal days into Earth hours.

faqs.question: Why shorter than 24h?
faqs.answer: A sidereal day measures Earth's rotation relative to stars.

title: Rain Barrel Fill Time
intro: Estimate time to fill a barrel from a hose.

faqs.question: Assumes constant flow?
faqs.answer: Yes, flow rate is assumed constant.

title: LED Strip Current Calculator
intro: Required current for an LED strip.

examples.description: 5 m at 14 W/m on 12 V ⇒ 5.83 A

faqs.question: Why divide by voltage?
faqs.answer: Current equals power divided by voltage.

title: Floor Tile Quantity
intro: Tiles needed to cover a rectangular floor.

faqs.question: Should I add extra tiles?
faqs.answer: Yes, buy a few extra to account for cuts and breakage.

title: Recipe Scale Factor
intro: Multiplier to scale ingredient quantities.

faqs.question: Does it adjust cook time?
faqs.answer: No, only ingredient quantities scale.

title: Pizza Slice Angle
intro: Degrees per slice of pizza.

faqs.question: Works for any round pizza?
faqs.answer: Yes, the angle depends only on slice count.

title: Queue Wait Time
intro: Estimate waiting time in line.

faqs.question: Does it account for multiple servers?
faqs.answer: No, it's a simple single-line estimate.

title: Simple Interest Calculator
intro: Compute interest earned with the simple interest formula. Enter the values and press Calculate.

faqs.question: What is simple interest?
faqs.answer: Interest calculated only on the principal amount.

title: Nautical Miles to Kilometers Converter
intro: Convert distance from nautical miles to kilometers for navigation and travel.

faqs.question: Is the conversion factor exact?
faqs.answer: Yes, one nautical mile equals exactly 1.852 kilometers.

faqs.question: When is a nautical mile used?
faqs.answer: Primarily in maritime and aviation contexts.

title: Bits to Bytes Converter
intro: Convert a quantity of bits into bytes, the fundamental unit of digital storage.

faqs.question: How many bits are in a byte?
faqs.answer: Eight bits make one byte.

faqs.question: Does this handle large numbers?
faqs.answer: Yes, enter any non‑negative numeric value.

title: Seconds to Weeks Converter
intro: Turn a number of seconds into whole or fractional weeks.

faqs.question: How many seconds are in a week?
faqs.answer: Exactly 604,800.

faqs.question: Can it handle fractional weeks?
faqs.answer: Yes, results may include decimals.

title: Light Travel Time Calculator
intro: Estimate how long light takes to traverse a distance in kilometers.

faqs.question: What speed is used?
faqs.answer: The speed of light in vacuum, 299,792.458 km/s.

faqs.question: Does medium affect the result?
faqs.answer: The calculator assumes a vacuum; other media slow light slightly.

title: Loan-to-Value Ratio Calculator
intro: Determine the loan-to-value (LTV) ratio expressed as a percentage.

faqs.question: What is LTV?
faqs.answer: It's the loan amount divided by property value.

faqs.question: Why is LTV important?
faqs.answer: Lenders use it to assess mortgage risk.

title: Return on Equity Calculator
intro: Measure a company's profitability relative to shareholder equity.

faqs.question: What does ROE indicate?
faqs.answer: How efficiently equity generates profits.

faqs.question: Is higher always better?
faqs.answer: Higher is generally better but compare within industry.

title: Maximum Heart Rate Calculator
intro: Find the estimated maximum beats per minute using the classic formula.

faqs.question: What formula is used?
faqs.answer: 220 minus age in years.

faqs.question: Is this accurate for everyone?
faqs.answer: It's a general guideline; individual results vary.

title: Daily Protein Needs Calculator
intro: Calculate recommended grams of protein per day using 0.8 g per kg.

faqs.question: What guideline is used?
faqs.answer: 0.8 grams of protein per kilogram of body weight.

faqs.question: Do athletes need more?
faqs.answer: Yes, active individuals may require higher intake.

title: Deck Board Quantity Calculator
intro: Estimate how many boards are needed based on deck and board dimensions.

examples.description: 6×4 m deck with 2×0.15 m boards ⇒ 80 boards
5×5 m deck with 2.5×0.1 m boards ⇒ 100 boards

faqs.question: Does this include wastage?
faqs.answer: No, consider ordering extra for cuts and mistakes.

faqs.question: Assumes boards span the deck length?
faqs.answer: Yes, boards are assumed to run the full deck length.

title: Post Hole Concrete Calculator
intro: Estimate concrete volume for a cylindrical post hole.

faqs.question: Does this include the post?
faqs.answer: No, it calculates the hole volume only.

faqs.question: Should I add extra?
faqs.answer: Many builders add about 10% for waste.

title: Sphere Volume Calculator
intro: Compute the volume enclosed by a sphere given its radius.

faqs.question: Are units cubed?
faqs.answer: Yes, volume units are cubic.

title: Circle Sector Area Calculator
intro: Find the area of a sector of a circle using radius and central angle in degrees.

faqs.question: What angle unit is used?
faqs.answer: Degrees.

faqs.question: What if the angle is 360°?
faqs.answer: The area equals that of the full circle.

title: IPv4 Subnet Host Count Calculator
intro: Determine how many usable addresses a subnet provides from its CIDR prefix length.

faqs.question: Why subtract 2?
faqs.answer: Network and broadcast addresses are reserved.

faqs.question: Prefixes over 30?
faqs.answer: They leave too few usable addresses.

title: Video File Size Calculator
intro: Compute approximate file size in megabytes using bitrate and duration.

faqs.question: Why divide by 8?
faqs.answer: There are 8 bits in a byte.

faqs.question: Is overhead included?
faqs.answer: No, actual size may vary due to encoding overhead.

title: Fuel Cost Per Mile Calculator
intro: Estimate driving cost per mile using fuel price and miles per gallon.

faqs.question: Can I use metric units?
faqs.answer: Yes, consistent units yield cost per distance.

faqs.question: Does it include maintenance?
faqs.answer: No, only fuel cost is considered.

title: Shower Water Usage Calculator
intro: Find out how many liters of water a shower consumes.

faqs.question: Typical shower flow rate?
faqs.answer: Around 9–12 liters per minute.

faqs.question: How can I reduce usage?
faqs.answer: Shorter showers or low-flow showerheads.
